alert.note: Alert for Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Frost Advisory issued December 13 at 2:29PM PST until December 14 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 8 AM PST TUESDAY... ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Frost Advisory, temperatures in the low to mid 30s will result in frost formation. For the High Wind Watch, south winds 20 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible. * WHERE...For the Frost Advisory, the Southern Oregon Coast. For the High Wind Watch, portions of the Southern Oregon Coast including Port Orford and Gold Beach. * WHEN...For the Frost Advisory, from 2 AM to 8 AM PST Tuesday. For the High Wind Watch, from Wednesday morning through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Frost could kill sensitive outdoor vegetation if left uncovered. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Dangerous driving conditions are possible, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Downed trees and power lines are possible. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.

area.areaDesc: Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast
